Summary: Saw an orange orb moving NE to SW across the sky.
divs: Sighting Details I was driving north on Interstate 255, a little south of 270, when I saw a strange looking orange light in the sky off to the North East. I did a "double take" because it looked kind of weird, and then decided to pull off onto the side of the highway so I could get a better look. Got out of the car and watched as what looked like an orange glowing sphere moved slowly (much too slow for a meteor) across the night sky from the North East to the South West. After looking for a minute, I went and got a monocular out of my glove compartment, in order to be able to look more closely. The monocular helped some, but only to increase the magnification - it still looked like an orange, glowing sphere at about an altitude of roughly 1 to 2,000 feet, moving at about the speed of an airplane in the sky, but with no flashing red, white, or green lights ... just a glowing & slightly pulsating orange spherical appearance ... After watching for about 3 to 4 minutes the object became hard to see as it moved off in the distance to the South West ... in the direction of Columbia, Il.
